New Records: The Indiana Pacers set a record for the lowest number combination (00) ever worn by a team in an NBA game during their match against the Chicago Bulls on January 9, 2025.
Key Match Events: The Indiana Pacers defeated the Chicago Bulls 129-113, securing their fourth consecutive win and improving their Eastern Conference standings to sixth.
Pre-Game Insights: The Indiana Pacers played without Myles Turner due to illness, with Thomas Bryant starting in his first game with the team since his November trade.
Post-Match Reflections: The Pacers' strong performance and record-setting moment boosted their confidence, with plans for potential trades as the season approaches the trade deadline.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The record-breaking lineup of Tyrese Haliburton, Bennedict Mathurin, Andrew Nembhard, Thomas Bryant, and Obi Toppin is unique and unlikely to be replicated due to the NBA's 00 number rule.
